condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1: Education stakeholders at different levels have improved capacity in education planning and programme implementation to improve access to quality education for the most disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: National and sub-national governments remain strongly committed in expanding access to quality, inclusive education for out-of-school children (OOSC) and children with disabilities (CWD). Continuous integration of relevant programmes and activities into governments' planning and policies shows greater commitment to support better learning opportunities for OOSC and CWD. With UNICEF's direct support, to date around 23,100 OOSC (48% girls, 52% boys, 95% adolescents) have enrolled back in school either through formal or non-formal education. In addition, around 334,000 able-children and CWD (48% girls, 3% with disabilities) have learned social inclusion values (e.g. respect, teamwork, tolerance) through physical education and sports. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/07/2020

title.narrative: A model for information-based education planning at village level ready for replication

actual.value: 2020:The model for information-based education planning at village level has been established in 4 focus districts. Its results have informed development of a Back to School Movement guideline which is used to facilitate second learning opportunities for OOSC. Currently, a review and documentation proces

title.narrative: A model for universal basic education for children in remote rural villages ready for replication

actual.value: 2020:The process of model development for universal basic education for children in remote rural villages in 4 focus districts is almost completed. Currently, a review and documentation process on the overall results is on-going to be used as reference for expanding the model to other areas.

title.narrative: SDG4 monitoring report published by MoEC annually

actual.value: 2020:The final draft of SDG4 monitoring report is available and its refinement process is on-going. The final version of the report will be launched in the fourth quarter of 2020 in collaboration with the MoEC.

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Existence of national strategies to address inequities in education access, participation and retention - score (1-4), see guidance
Knowledge and attitudes of community members and teachers on inclusive education

actual.value: 2020:Following the interventions, there has been overall improved knowledge and positive attitudes of parents, community members, teachers, and headmasters towards children with disabilities and inclusive education. Teachers' average KAP scores increased from 68 to 71, while headmasters' scores increased
